title: Sources: WNBA sets deadline to keep '26 intact
content: The WNBA told the union and its teams on Monday that a new CBA should be agreed to by March 10 for the 2026 schedule not to be impacted, sources told ESPN.

title: Mayweather-Pacquiao 2 set for Sept. at Sphere

content: The U.S. women's hockey Olympic gold medal-winning team has politely declined an invitation from President Donald Trump to attend his State of the Union address.

title: On the independence of the Election Commission
content: An independent Election Commission is the bedrock of Indian democracy. To ensure that it remains so, various safeguards are built into the basic structure of the Constitution

title: Chhattisgarh GSDP to grow by 8.11% in 2025-26: Economic Survey
content: As per advance estimates, Chhattisgarh’s GSDP at constant price (base year 2011-12) is expected to grow at 8.11% and reach ₹3,58,293 crore in 2025-26 as against ₹3,31,402 crore in FY25, the report mentions.

title: Rally held to urge political parties to add Tamil language conservation in their election manifestos

title: Row over former BJP MP turning away Muslim women from charity event
content: In a video footage of the event circulated on social media, Mr. Jaunpuria was seen enquiring about the recipients’ names. When a woman identified herself as Shakuran Bano, the former MP reacted sharply, asking her to step aside and leave the blanket behind

title: Six hospitalised after eating contaminated food in Indore's Bhagirathpura
content: Around 60 people had eaten food at a birthday party in Bhagirathpura late Saturday night. Following this, some people developed health problems on Sunday, Chief Medical and Health Officer (CMHO) Dr Madhav Hasani stated.

title: Kuno National Park to get 8 cheetahs from Botswana on Feb. 28
content: Botswana is the third African nation to send cheetahs to India as part of Project Cheetah. Two batches of cheetahs have arrived from Namibia and South Africa since the project was kickstarted in September, 2022

title: Odisha deported 73 Bangladeshi nationals since May 2025: CM

title: Bharat Taxi will guarantee minimum base rate per kilometre for all drivers: Amit Shah

title: From Slum To Villa: Bhopal Sisters Arrested In Alleged Conversion-Sex Racket Scandal
content: In a chilling case that has sent shockwaves through Madhya Pradesh's capital, two sisters from Bhopal have been arrested on charges of rape, forced religious conversion, and allegedly running a sex racket under the guise of providing jobs.

title: Why Congress Is Pushing For 40 Seats In Tamil Nadu
content: As seat-sharing negotiations intensify between the Congress and DMK, the Dravidian party is refusing to back down and has offered the Congress 25 seats that it offered the national party in 2021.

title: Mexico's Cartel Map: The Major Drug Empires And Where They Rule

title: Kim Jong Un's Sister Kim Yo Jong Promoted As Kim Family Tightens Power Grip

title: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan Receives Eye Treatment At Hospital

title: Anthropic CEO To Meet US Defence Secretary In "Not Friendly" Showdown

title: UP Receives Rs 20,000 Crore Investment Proposals From Singapore

title: Delhi Customs Seize 1 Kg Gold, 10 Kg Silver, Luxury Watches From US Woman

title: After El Mencho's Death, Spotlight On El Chapo, Forbes' Billionaire Drug Lord

title: On Camera, 65-Year-Old Man Thrashed By Car Driver In Bengaluru Road Rage
content: The car driver followed the 65-year-old pedestrian and thrashed him despite mediation attempts by passersby. The incident, which took place on Sunday evening, was recorded on CCTV cameras.

title: Youth Congress Chief Arrested Over Shirtless Protest During AI Impact Summit

title: '250 Officers, 50 Lakh Claims': Judiciary Rushes To Help Poll Body In Bengal

title: 4 Die After Consuming "Adulterated Milk" In Andhra, 1 Arrested
content: Four people have died after allegedly consuming adulterated milk in Rajamahendravaram city in Andhra Pradesh, the East Godavari district administration said on Monday.

title: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch

title: Olympic standouts, disappointments from all 32 NHL teams
content: the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament ended in thrilling fashion . both teams were comprised of players -- many of them superstars . all but one of the countries had at least one active NHL player on the roster . it's time to assess which players will be coming home content with how they performed .

title: A gold medal 46 years in the making: Inside Team USA's epic win over Canada
content: Connor Hellebuyck and canada's Jordan Binnington win the men's hockey gold medal . he is the reigning NHL MVP and winner of the Vezina Trophy as the league's best goaltender . the game went into overtime on tuesday .

title: Kings of the hot corner: Buster Olney ranks baseball's best third basemen
content: we rank the best of the best at third base . we will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the goal of this exercise is to identify the best players for the 2026 season, not who might be best in five years or over their career.

title: USA Basketball's road to 2028: New era, new coach, new decisions
content: in 2024, a team USA squad full of stars, role players, up-and-comers and legends survived two thrillers . a 95-91 win over Nikola Jokic -led Serbia squad and an exhausting 98-87 clincher over host France . it doesn't appear that USA Basketball's graybearded Avengers will reassemble to chase a sixth consecutive gold .

title: Way-too-early preview for the 2030 Olympics
content: the 2030 Olympics will be spread across the country on sunday . the ice seemed tilted very much in the american's favor for the first time . it's clear Team USA is building a potential dynasty . if you paid attention in the lead-up and during the Games, it is clear team USA could have some growing pain .

title: Who's the best second baseman in MLB? Buster Olney ranks the top 10
content: ESPN's Buster Olney ranked the best of the best at second base . we will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the most coveted free agent in the fall will be Tarik Skubal .

title: 🎖️ Shots of gold: Winter Olympics, in pictures
content: the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics have come to a close, bringing thrilling action and memorable moments in spades . we compiled collages that take a look at the story of each of the Games' days overall, as well as one specific snapshot of particular significance .

title: 'Raw' results: Styles WWE Hall of Fame-bound, Elimination Chamber matches set
content: Randy Orton expresses his desire to win another world title . the final competitors for the men's and women's Elimination chamber matches will earn guaranteed spots at WrestleMania 42 in April . there are still some details that need to be ironed out .

title: 'Pressure to crack NEET': Teen shoots father in front of sister; chops up body, stuffs it into blue drum
content: A 19-year-old allegedly shot his father dead over NEET pressure, then dismembered the body. He attempted to dispose of the remains, but was caught by police while trying to hide the torso. The accused confessed after being intercepted with suspicious activity. Investigations are ongoing to recover all body parts.

title: Caught on camera: Noida youth shot dead at doorstep in broad daylight
content: A man named Nitin was shot dead in Greater Noida due to an old rivalry. CCTV footage shows multiple assailants attacking and shooting the victim. Police have launched an investigation to apprehend all those involved in the killing.

title: ‘If Pakistan serious about WC’: Ashwin’s explosive warning before England clash
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has advised Pakistan to promote Fakhar Zaman to the middle order for their crucial Super 8 clash against England. Ashwin believes Zaman's ability to sweep and use his feet can counter England's spinners, Adil Rashid and Liam Dawson, citing Nepal's successful strategy against Rashid.

title: After OpenAI, Anthropic warns US govt on China
content: AI giant Anthropic accuses Chinese firms DeepSeek, MiniMax, and Moonshot AI of illicitly training their models using Claude outputs. These companies allegedly created thousands of fake accounts, generating millions of exchanges to steal capabilities, raising security concerns and prompting calls for industry action and export controls.

title: Pawan Hans helicopter, with 7 onboard, crashes into sea in Andaman; all rescued
content: A Pawan Hans helicopter experienced a short landing near Mayabunder in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands shortly after departing Port Blair. The aircraft was carrying two crew members and five passengers. Fortunately, all individuals were safely rescued with no reported injuries. Authorities are investigating the incident, and those on board are receiving medical observation.

title: Karnataka HC grants Ranveer Singh interim relief, bars coercive action over ‘Kantara’ mimicry row
content: The Karnataka High Court has granted actor Ranveer Singh interim protection from coercive action by Bengaluru police, provided he cooperates with the investigation. This order comes after Singh challenged an FIR registered against him for mimicking a character from the Kannada movie 'Kantara: Chapter 1' during a promotional event.

title: ‘Shirtless’ protest row: Cong, BJP trade barbs over Uday Bhanu’s arrest — who said what
content: Delhi Police have taken Indian Youth Congress President Uday Bhanu Chib into four-day custody following his arrest for orchestrating a shirtless protest at the Bharat Mandapam during the AI Impact Summit. The demonstration targeted Prime Minister Modi and the India-US trade deal. Congress leaders defended the protest as a democratic right, while the BJP criticized Rahul Gandhi's stance.

title: America's biggest investor has an 'end question' for tech giants
content: Investor Michael Burry is questioning Big Tech's massive AI spending, highlighting concerns over ballooning debt and accounting practices. Companies are investing hundreds of billions in AI infrastructure, leading to significant borrowing and potential overstatement of earnings. Burry draws parallels to the early electricity boom, where transformative technology didn't prevent investor losses.

title: Trump's tariff game might not be over just yet, here's what US is planning
content: Following a Supreme Court setback, the US is launching new national security probes into sectors like batteries and telecom equipment, potentially leading to fresh tariffs. President Trump also threatened higher duties on countries exploiting the ruling, aiming to replace invalidated levies with legally sustainable measures under Section 232 and Section 301.

title: CBSE class 12 Accountancy exam: Students call paper lengthy, teachers say it was balanced
content: The CBSE Class 12 Accountancy exam was conducted nationwide from 10:30 AM to 1:30 PM, with lakhs of students appearing. Initial reactions suggest the paper followed the prescribed pattern and covered partnership accounts, company accounts, cash flow statements, and ratios. The exam focused on accuracy, working notes, and standard formats. The official question paper PDF has now been released, allowing students to review answers, check patterns, and analyse their performance in detail.

title: US SC's blow to Trump: FedEx sues US admin seeking 'full refund' of tariffs
content: FedEx is suing for a refund of Trump-era tariffs deemed illegal by the Supreme Court. This landmark ruling could trigger billions in claims, as the court found the president exceeded his authority.  Importers like FedEx, who paid these duties, are now seeking full reimbursement, potentially impacting numerous businesses and consumers.

title: IBM stock’s worst single-day drop in 25 yrs over Anthropic tool
content: IBM shares plummeted after AI startup Anthropic announced its tool can automate COBOL modernization, threatening IBM's core mainframe business. This AI advancement could compress years-long, costly migration projects into months, impacting recurring revenue from hardware, software, and services. The market reacted swiftly, signaling a potential shift in the legacy IT services landscape.

title: Why is stock market down? Nifty50 below 25,450; Sensex down 1,000 points - top reasons
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex tanked in trade on Tuesday on weak global cues and IT stocks rout along with fresh tariff threats from US President Donald Trump. While Nifty50 dropped over 280 points, BSE Sensex went below the 82,300.

title: 'India not going to hold back': Zimbabwe brace for aggressive backlash in do-or-die clash
content: Zimbabwe's coach anticipates a fierce Indian onslaught in Chennai, drawing parallels to their recent defeat against the West Indies.  He stressed the need for his team to adapt and disrupt India's aggressive batting, particularly Suryakumar Yadav.  Zimbabwe aim to learn from their previous loss and challenge the tournament favourites on a Chennai pitch offering unexpected pace and bounce.

title: ‘Engine failure’ prompts mayday call; SpiceJet flight makes emergency landing in Delhi
content: A SpiceJet Boeing 737 carrying 150 passengers returned to Delhi shortly after takeoff for Leh due to a reported engine failure. The aircraft, which departed at 6:08 am, landed safely at 6:49 am. SpiceJet confirmed a technical issue, stating the aircraft landed normally with no fire warning.

title: Many worlds of AI: For investors, the implications are significant
content: When you hear "AI" attached to a business function, ask: what happens when it's wrong? If the answer involves customers, regulators, or reputations, progress will be slower than vendor PPTs claim.

title: T20 World Cup: How Sri Lanka could secure crucial home semi-final advantage
content: Sri Lanka could gain a significant home advantage in the T20 World Cup 2026 semi-finals at Colombo's R Premadasa Stadium. This is contingent on Pakistan qualifying, or if Sri Lanka reach the semi-finals and their opponent is not India. Otherwise, Kolkata will host the fixture.

title: 'Peaceful protest our right': Rahul backs Youth Congress after chief's arrest
content: Rahul Gandhi lauded Indian Youth Congress members for protesting against Prime Minister Narendra Modi. He stated, "Peaceful protest is our historic heritage. It is in our blood and is the democratic right of every Indian." Gandhi criticized a trade deal with America, claiming it compromises national interests and harms farmers and the textile industry.

title: 'Lost my leg, but never my will' How Sudha Chandran returned to the stage
content: Bharatanatyam dancer Sudha Chandran's life irrevocably changed at 16 after a bus accident led to the amputation of her right leg. Despite immense pain and doubt, she embraced the Jaipur Foot and relentlessly trained. Her triumphant 1984 comeback performance stunned audiences, proving resilience and artistic brilliance can overcome profound loss, inspiring millions across India.

title: Axar snub raises questions: Why was Washington picked ahead of India vice-captain?
content: India's team management prioritised match-ups over vice-captaincy, benching Axar Patel for Washington Sundar against South Africa in their Super 8 clash. Despite Axar's strong record, Sundar was chosen for his off-spin against left-handers. This decision, along with Sundar's batting position, has raised questions about the team's strategy as they enter the tournament's crucial stages.

title: Congress seeks 35 seats in Tamil Nadu, DMK offers 28 citing larger alliance
content: Congress is pushing for 35 seats in the upcoming elections, but alliance leader DMK is reportedly offering only a slight increase from their 2021 count of 25. Talks are ongoing, with Congress also seeking more local body posts and a Rajya Sabha seat. DMK acknowledges the need to accommodate new allies, potentially impacting seat allocations.

title: Great news! Rs 5.16 crore toll refund for Mumbai-Pune Expressway jam
content: Motorists stranded in the massive Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic jam on February 3 will receive a Rs 5.16 crore toll refund. Over one lakh vehicle owners will have their FASTag accounts credited directly. The decision follows a gas tanker overturning, causing a 33-hour disruption and automatic toll deductions despite a suspension order.

title: Kamal Bungalow: How this house was built by tapping the energy of sunlight
content: Leena Dandekar shares her firsthand account of building Kamal Bungalow, a sustainable home in Pune. Driven by a belief in eco-friendly living, she prioritized solar energy, water harvesting, and green roofs. The home also features a productive garden, free-range chickens, and refurbished furniture, creating a harmonious and resource-efficient living space.

title: Robert Carradine, ‘Revenge of the Nerds’ actor, dies at 71
content: Robert Carradine, the veteran actor known for Revenge of the Nerds and Lizzie McGuire, has died at age 71. His family disclosed that he died by suicide after a long struggle with Bipolar Disorder, describing him as a 'beacon of light' who touched many lives. They hope sharing his story will help reduce mental health stigma.

title: Vicky Kaushal praises Katrina, calls her warrior, talks about son Vihaan
content: Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif welcomed their son, Vihaan Kaushal, in November 2025. Vicky recently praised Katrina as a "superhero" and "warrior" mother, expressing immense pride. He also humorously claimed to be better at changing diapers than acting, while admitting the emotional difficulty of leaving his son so soon after his birth.

title: 'Mistakes happen': Steve Bucknor regrets giving Sachin Tendulkar out 22 years ago
content: Former umpire Steve Bucknor has admitted to making a mistake in a controversial LBW decision against Sachin Tendulkar during the 2003-04 Brisbane Test. Bucknor confessed that Tendulkar should not have been given out, as the ball was missing the stumps. This admission confirms long-held fan beliefs about the erroneous call.

title: Bengal SIR: SC asks EC to bear cost for deploying out-of-state judicial officers
content: The Supreme Court has authorized the Calcutta High Court Chief Justice to bring in judicial officers from Jharkhand and Odisha to speed up the verification of voter claims in West Bengal's electoral roll revision. This move aims to address a significant backlog, with the Election Commission bearing the costs.

title: Gold price prediction: Will gold prices continue their uptrend?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices may continue to rise if the US dollar weakness persists, says Praveen Singh, Senior Fundamental Research Analyst- Currencies and Commodities at Mirae Asset Sharekhan:

title: Took off, lost contact in 20 minutes: How a medical evacuation flight from Jharkhand ended in tragedy
content: A medical evacuation flight from Ranchi to Delhi crashed in Jharkhand's Chatra district on Monday evening, killing all seven people on board. The aircraft requested a deviation due to bad weather shortly after takeoff before losing radar contact. An investigation is underway to determine the exact cause of the crash.

title: 'Provided logistics' for 'shirtless' protest: Why Delhi Police arrested youth Congress chief
content: Delhi Police arrested Indian Youth Congress chief Uday Bhanu Chib and seven others for a shirtless protest at Bharat Mandapam during the AI Summit. The Youth Congress condemned the arrests as "an undeclared emergency," while Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera criticized the government's reaction to peaceful dissent. Protesters displayed anti-PM slogans.

title: Refusal to marry after intimacy over ‘kundali’ mismatch can attract BNS charges: HC
content: Refusing marriage after a physical relationship, based on a horoscope mismatch despite prior assurances, can now lead to charges under Section 69 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita for deceitful sexual intercourse. The Delhi High Court made this observation while denying bail to a man accused of such actions, highlighting repeated promises of marriage that were later broken.

title: IND vs ZIM: ‘Fresh’ Chepauk pitch should bring welcome relief for India
content: Team India's T20 struggles have put pitch conditions under scrutiny ahead of their must-win game against Zimbabwe.  Chennai's Chepauk pitch, traditionally slow, has surprisingly offered better bounce this World Cup, potentially aiding India's big-hitters against Zimbabwe's pace-off bowlers.  Batting first appears to be the preferred strategy given recent night-game results.

title: FM Sitharaman rules out roadmap for PSU bank mergers, panel to review sector reforms
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated there is no roadmap for public sector bank mergers, indicating consolidation is not actively considered. A new banking reform panel will review the sector's future, examining all aspects to strengthen the ecosystem and align it with India's growth goals.

title: Anthropic Claude Code tool impact: IBM share price crashes most in 25 years
content: Since the majority of mainframe computers running COBOL are produced by IBM, the development triggered heavy selling in the company’s stock. The stock dropped as much as 13% during intraday trading, marking its steepest single-day fall since March 2020.

title: Ex-Nato commander warns US Middle East buildup mirrors 'Dante’s Inferno'
content: Former NATO commander Admiral James Stavridis likened the US military buildup around Iran to "Dante's Inferno," describing concentric rings of firepower.  This massive deployment includes strategic bombers, two aircraft carrier groups, and Tomahawk missile capabilities.  The move comes amid escalating US-Iran tensions, with Washington ordering non-essential staff out of Lebanon and Tehran vowing fierce retaliation against any strike.

title: IT stocks fall today: Infosys, TCS, HCL plunge sharply — what triggered the sell-off?
content: IT stocks experienced a sharp decline as Anthropic's Claude Code tool showed potential to modernize legacy COBOL systems. This development triggered concerns about AI's impact on traditional IT services, with major players seeing significant drops in their share prices. The news highlights a growing unease about AI fundamentally reshaping the industry's competitive landscape and business models.

title: Mexico drug lord El Mencho killed; cartel rampage halts cities: What happened in last 24 hrs
content: Mexico experienced intense cartel violence following the military operation that killed drug lord "El Mencho." The retaliation included arson, blockades, and gun battles across multiple states, prompting the deployment of 10,000 troops. Authorities tracked and killed the CJNG leader, but his death has led to widespread unrest and a prison break.

title: Wobble at top: India rethink options as left-heavy top order keeps misfiring
content: India's T20 World Cup campaign faces a crisis as the much-hyped top order falters, leading to predictable collapses and growing doubts. Opposition teams have easily decoded the batting lineup, forcing management to consider significant changes. The team's batting coach acknowledges the need for a different approach, hinting at potential alterations for upcoming crucial matches.

title: T20 World Cup: How Babar Azam went from 'King' to 'match ka mujrim'
content: Once hailed as Pakistan’s next batting great, Babar Azam now finds himself under intense scrutiny. Despite towering career numbers, his poor strike rate, powerplay struggles, and inability to adapt to modern T20 demands have eroded his aura. As Pakistan rethink roles and combinations, Babar’s place, purpose, and future in the format hang in the balance.

title: Stephen Curry and Ayesha Curry’s viral relationship test reveals surprises
content: Stephen and Ayesha Curry's enduring relationship was highlighted in a viral relationship test. It revealed personal details like nicknames, favorite features, and even their first realization of mutual interest. The couple, married since 2011, met as teenagers and reconnected in 2008, showcasing their strong bond through shared knowledge and playful interactions.
